pr_title: SwiftLint: Type Elements should start with a lowercase.

timeline.message: SwiftLint: Type name and element should start with a lowercase character.
SwiftLint: Type elements starst with a lowercase character.
SwiftLint: Type elements starts with a lowercase character.
SwiftLint: Type elements starts with a lowercase character.

timeline.author: nikklassen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -19,39 +19,39 @@
 import Foundation
 
 enum UserType: Int {
-  case AnonymousUser = 0
-  case FDAUser
+  case anonymousUser = 0
+  case loggedUser

timeline.bodyText: why aren't these just constants? They don't really describe different aspects of the same concept
timeline.author: nikklassen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -30,51 +30,51 @@ enum DirectoryType: String {
 
 enum ScreenSize {
 
-  static let SCREEN_WIDTH = UIScreen.main.bounds.size.width
-  static let SCREEN_HEIGHT = UIScreen.main.bounds.size.height
-  static let SCREEN_MAX_LENGTH = max(ScreenSize.SCREEN_WIDTH, ScreenSize.SCREEN_HEIGHT)
-  static let SCREEN_MIN_LENGTH = min(ScreenSize.SCREEN_WIDTH, ScreenSize.SCREEN_HEIGHT)
+  static let screenWidth = UIScreen.main.bounds.size.width

replies.bodyText: These are constants only but will be instantiated on runtime based on device width and height.
replies.author: tushar-boston

replies.bodyText: Right, but what I meant is this isn't an enum. By calling it an enum people are going to think it's different types of screen sizes, but it's just 4 different numbers you've group together. Please change it to something that isn't an enum.
replies.author: nikklassen

replies.bodyText: Makes sense. Updated them to struct so that they're still scoped in a type and can be accessed globally.
replies.author: tushar-boston

timeline.bodyText: This also doesn't seem like an enum.  DeviceType should be these named values, but then you should have a function called getDeviceType that returns the correct one dynamically.
timeline.author: nikklassen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -30,51 +30,51 @@ enum DirectoryType: String {
 
 enum ScreenSize {
 
-  static let SCREEN_WIDTH = UIScreen.main.bounds.size.width
-  static let SCREEN_HEIGHT = UIScreen.main.bounds.size.height
-  static let SCREEN_MAX_LENGTH = max(ScreenSize.SCREEN_WIDTH, ScreenSize.SCREEN_HEIGHT)
-  static let SCREEN_MIN_LENGTH = min(ScreenSize.SCREEN_WIDTH, ScreenSize.SCREEN_HEIGHT)
+  static let screenWidth = UIScreen.main.bounds.size.width
+  static let screenHeight = UIScreen.main.bounds.size.height
+  static let screenMaxLength = max(ScreenSize.screenWidth, ScreenSize.screenHeight)
+  static let screenMinLength = min(ScreenSize.screenWidth, ScreenSize.screenHeight)
 }
 
 enum DeviceType {
 
-  static let IS_IPHONE_4_OR_LESS =
+  static let isIPhone4OrLess =

replies.author: tushar-boston

replies.bodyText: I understand how you are using this. But again, this is not how enums are supposed to work. An enum would enumerate the possible device types.
replies.author: nikklassen

timeline.author: nikklassen
timeline.diffHunk:

timeline.bodyText: why do these need to be strings now?
timeline.author: nikklassen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -22,21 +22,32 @@ import UIKit
 
 enum StatisticsFormula: String {
 
-  case Summation
-  case Average
-  case Maximum
-  case Minimum
+  case summation = "Summation"

replies.bodyText: To instantiate it. The existing code was instantiating them using the raw values which are coming from APIs. I've explicitly defined the raw values so that they won't break.
replies.author: tushar-boston

timeline.bodyText: Did you make this a string so that this doesn't have to be a switch?
timeline.author: nikklassen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -19,38 +20,38 @@
 import UIKit
 
 enum StatisticsType: String {
-  case Activity
-  case Sleep
-  case Weight
-  case Nutrition
-  case HeartRate
-  case BloodGlucose
-  case ActiveTask
-  case BabyKicks
-  case Mood
-  case Other
+  case activity = "Activity"
+  case sleep = "Sleep"
+  case weight = "Weight"
+  case nutrition = "Nutrition"
+  case heartRate = "HeartRate"
+  case bloodGlucose = "BloodGlucose"
+  case activeTask = "ActiveTask"
+  case babyKicks = "BabyKicks"
+  case mood = "Mood"
+  case other = "Other"
 
   var description: String {
     switch self {

replies.bodyText: No, these are raw values to instantiate the enum. if we don't define them, by default enum can be instantiated using the element name.
replies.author: tushar-boston

timeline.message: Rename UserType case loggedUser to loggedInUser.
Change ScreenSize and DeviceSize type to struct.
